title: Where China Is Changing Its Diplomatic Ways (at Least a Little)
abstract: As relations with the U.S. and Europe plummet, Beijing is beginning a new wave of diplomacy in Africa, where it dominates trade with resource-rich nations.

title: As Ukraine Signs Up Soldiers, Questions Arise About How It Chooses

title: Last Stand at Azovstal: Inside the Siege That Shaped the Ukraine War
abstract: For 80 days, at a sprawling steelworks, a relentless Russian assault met unyielding Ukrainian resistance. This is how it was for those who fought, and for those trapped beneath the battlefield.

multimedia.caption: By May, after months of battle, the Azovstal Iron and Steel Works was a charred skeleton.

title: Myanmar Executes Four Pro-Democracy Activists, Defying Foreign Leaders
abstract: They were the country’s first executions in more than 30 years. Daw Aung San Suu Kyi, the ousted civilian leader who was detained during last year’s coup, remains in prison.
des_facet: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity

multimedia.caption: U Phyo Zeya Thaw, left, leaving Parliament with Daw Aung San Suu Kyi in Myanmar’s capital, Naypyidaw, in 2016. Mr. Phyo Zeya Thaw was one of four pro-democracy activists executed Saturday.

title: Below an Israeli City, a Musical Harmony Belies the Tensions Above Ground
